messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Bible Belt (was conservative eternal spanking  or something)
messages.msgSnippet: ... I d add Virginia too. Or maybe its the crotch :-) Shyrley
messages.messageBody:
SandraDodd@... wrote:

> In a message dated 1/24/03 6:59:00 PM, homemama@... writes:
>
> << Where exactly is the Bible Belt? I'm guessing Ohio is in it. ;-) >>
>
> Ohio's not, I think.
>
> Texas, Oklahoma, on across the south to South Carolina.
>
> Kentucky and Tennessee are in.
>
> Ohio and Pennsylvania are not.
>
> I'm doing this from a guess and personal experience of people saying it,
> haven't looked at anyone else's official estimation of its borders or any
> "definitions."
>
> Southern Florida is probably not included, being so heavily Jewish and
> Catholic these days.
>
> Sandra
>

I'd add Virginia too. Or maybe its the crotch :-)

Shyrley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Bible Belt (was conservative eternal	spanking or something)
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks now I know where never to move to. LOL! It s just so much of this sounds so familiar. I left a church as they were starting to do some of these Parent
messages.messageBody:
Thanks now I know where never to move to. LOL! It's just so much of this
sounds so familiar. I left a church as they were starting to do some of
these "Parent Classes" I just couldn't stomach it and I grew up in a baptist
church. I know where some of it came from for me. I spanked when my oldest
was very young. I didn't know the options to pull out of that bag of
"tricks" yet. Yuck! I'm glad it's been gone out of my life for good. Now
it's getting even better & better. ;-)

Barb E
The best preparation for the future is a happy today :-)

Sandra Dodd

messages.subject: Bible Belt (was conservative eternal spanking or something)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/24/03 6:59:00 PM, homemama@infinet.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/24/03 6:59:00 PM, homemama@... writes:

<< Where exactly is the Bible Belt? I'm guessing Ohio is in it. ;-) >>

Ohio's not, I think.

Texas, Oklahoma, on across the south to South Carolina.

Kentucky and Tennessee are in.

Ohio and Pennsylvania are not.

I'm doing this from a guess and personal experience of people saying it,
haven't looked at anyone else's official estimation of its borders or any
"definitions."

Southern Florida is probably not included, being so heavily Jewish and
Catholic these days.

Sandra
